page.title: 02FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: Daniel wrote about his father's farm where wheat and barley are the main crops grown.These are drilled in Spring and Autumn and are harvested in August or September.The crops are fertilized in Spring for stronger growth and to replace goodness.They are sprayed with weed-killer to prevent being smothered early stages. This is done by one man and a tractor. Harvesting needs more men.The large farms are mainly arable and the straw is burnt.The smaller farms bale the straw for use as animal bedding.Oil- seedrape is grown for production of margarine.It is sown in Autumn and harvested the next September.Birds are pests with this particular crop and are controlled by a man with his gun. This new bright yellow crop is a spectacular sight in the fields.
